div.p: After the consulship of our master Arcadius, eternal Augustus, for the 2nd time and of Flavius Rufinus, vir clarissimus, Pachon 2 . . . from the splendid and most splendid city of the Oxyrhynchites, to the heirs of . . . Aeatius son of Aeion, from the same city, greetings. I acknowledge that I have received and been paid . . . (N. Gonis)
